ai.summary: The 6 Dales Trail is a demanding long-distance hike in the UK, covering 236.6 km with varied terrain and a hard difficulty rating. It suits experienced hikers prepared for multi-day trekking.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect diverse terrain: limestone dales, exposed moorland, forest tracks, river crossings, and occasional road sections. Significant elevation gain with long ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard, multi-day trek. Prepare for variable UK weather and navigation challenges. Carry a map and compass, inform someone of your itinerary, and allow for contingency days. Start early, stay hydrated, monitor fatigue, and be prepared to turn back if conditions worsen.
recommended_gear: Quality hiking boots with ankle support
Layered clothing system (base layer, fleece, insulated layer)
Backpack with rain cover (40-60 L depending on trip length)
Navigation tools: map, compass, and optional GPS device
Hydration system or water bottles (2-3 L capacity)
First aid kit and blister care
Sleeping bag and sleeping liner (for multi-day trips)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly late March to early October) are best for daylight and more favorable weather, though conditions can vary.
